title: Outside Buckingham Palace, a man arrested after incident
description: According to London police, the man is thought to have thrown shotgun cartridges into the grounds outside of the residence of the British monarch.

title: Blast derails Russian freight train in region bordering Ukraine
description: On Tuesday, May 2 – and for the second day in a row – a freight train derailed in Russia's Bryansk region due to an 'explosive device' placed on the tracks.

title: Biden administration announces 1,500 US troops to be sent to Mexico border
description: This deployment comes ahead of an anticipated migrant surge after Covid restrictions are lifted next week.

title: Met Gala pays colorful homage to Karl Lagerfeld
description: New York's Metropolitan Museum of Art rolled out the red carpet for a glittering array of celebrities wearing extreme fashion to celebrate the German designer who died in 2019.

title: Sudan rivals agree to seven-day ceasefire
description: South Sudan’s foreign ministry, which made the announcement, say the truce will start from Thursday.

title: 'Godfather of AI' quits Google to send warning of future tech dangers
description: Geoffrey Hinton shared his concerns about 'profound risks to society and humanity'  stemming from the same technology he helped build.

title: 'In China, arrests of Chinese people and foreigners accused of espionage are increasing'
description: Searches due to suspicions of espionage are becoming more and more frequent in the country, notes Le Monde's correspondent in China Frédéric Lemaître.

title: Uzbekistan's constitutional referendum was tailor-made for the president
description: The reform, which was overwhelmingly approved on April 30, allows Shavkat Mirziyoyev to remain in power until 2040. The campaign was marked by saturation advertising to persuade the people to go to the polls.

title: In Iran, businesses that accept non-veiled female customers are being closed
description: Iranian women who refuse to wear the hijab face increasing levels of intimidation, including being refused service by cabs and denunciations.

title: Luxury brands are once again dreaming about Asia
description: Four months after China's Covid-19 restrictions were lifted, luxury goods sales are booming.

title: Le Pen chooses to spend Labor Day in Normandy’s industrial heart
description: Far-right leader Marine Le Pen used May 1 to visit Le Havre and lambast President Emmanuel Macron's policies.

title: French unions set new protest date against enacted pension reform
description: On the day after large May Day demonstrations, the labor union leaders agreed to march again on June 6, two days before a Parliament debate on legislation that would repeal the reform.

title: COP28 chair urges tripling of renewables capacity by 2030
description: The UN's climate expert panel said earlier this year the world risks crossing the key 1.5-degree Celsius global warming limit in about a decade, urging a dramatic reduction in planet-heating emissions.

title: Ukraine intensifies sabotage operations in border regions with Russia
description: According to the Ukrainian defense minister, a counter-offensive to recover occupied territories will happen soon.

title: Pro-independence party's victory in French Polynesia complicates France's Indo-Pacific strategy
description: A pro-independence party won the elections on Sunday in the Pacific archipelago, while discussions on the status of New Caledonia are resuming with difficulty.

title: French government leans on police and prefects to quell protests
description: The government is heavily relying on police and local authorities to counteract planned protests, leading to controversial decisions like the use of drones or decrees based on anti-terrorist legislation.

title: Palestinian prisoner Khader Adnan dies in Israeli custody after hunger strike
description: Adnan, 45, began his strike shortly after being arrested on February 5. Over the years, he has been repeatedly arrested by Israel and became a symbol of steadfastness in the face of Israel's occupation.

title: US hopes to prevent snowball effect after First Republic Bank bankruptcy
description: In a deal announced Monday, J.P. Morgan acquired the San Francisco-based institution, whose deposits are fully guaranteed. Since March, three banks have failed.

title: Thousands of Hollywood writers to strike over pay and work conditions
description: Film and television writers decided to go on strike after talks with studios and streaming platforms failed. The US entertainment industry faces disruption as this year's releases could be delayed.

title: Italy's Giorgia Meloni chooses International Workers' Day to cut minimum incomes
description: Italy's far-right-dominated government has scrapped the 'citizens’ income' instituted in 2019, which lifted a million people out of poverty. A less ambitious scheme will be kept for the poorest families with children, elderly people and people with disabilities.
